definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: And I like to use Epee, Kendo , and Broadsword styles.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢使用重剑，剑道以及阔刀风格。

sentences.english: Don't give up chasing your goals. That is something that is unique to the art of Kendo.
sentences.chinese: 不要放弃自己的目标，这就是剑道与众不同的地方。

sentences.english: In Canada, lot of people don't know that we are very strong in kendo.
sentences.chinese: 在加拿大，很多人都不知道，我们剑道非常强。

sentences.english: Coach of the Hong Kong Team of The 9 th World Kendo Championship.
sentences.chinese: 第九回世界剑道选手权大会香港队教练。

definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
great scholar respected for learning and integrity
a kind of traditional Chinese sword-play
to bid farewell/tricks of the trade/pithy mnemonic formula (e.g. Mao Zedong's 16-character mantra 十六字訣|十六字诀 on guerrilla warfare)
(of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
Wugong County in Xianyang 咸陽|咸阳[Xian2 yang2], Shaanxi
martial art/military accomplishments/(Peking opera) martial arts feats
